intro: Acrotriche rigida, commonly known as the rigid acrotriche, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick, ribbed stems. It typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in coastal or desert areas. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
